SENT.plain: In an effort to improve detection of P-glycoprotein-mediated multidrug resistance (mdr), several dyes were compared to rhodamine 123 (R123) in efflux assays
Two dyes (SY-38 and SY-3150) were found that provided better sensitivity
These dyes were effluxed by a cell line known to be mdr-positive (P388/R84) but not by an mdr-negative cell line (P388)
Efflux was blocked by both verapamil and cyclosporine A
Efflux from KG1a cells was less than from P388/R84, just as has been seen with R123 and daunomycin
In further experiments, a model system was used to demonstrate two-color immunofluorescence plus efflux measurements
This was done using a sequential staining method
A procedure was devised that, at least for this model system, allowed single-step staining with both dye and antibody
The sensitivity of the efflux measurement was slightly compromised by using this one-step staining method
